thread.title: Central Connecticut State tops Bryant 35-33 in shootout
thread.title_full: Central Connecticut State tops Bryant 35-33 in shootout

title: Central Connecticut State tops Bryant 35-33 in shootout
text:
All-purpose Nash racks up yardage to lead Central Connecticut State over Bryant 35-33 THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   4:37   4:37   
Subjects: 
Connecticut (333) 

MANSFIELD, Connecticut — Cameron Nash had 104 yards receiving, 102 in kickoff returns, 90 rushing and a touchdown to lift Central Connecticut State past Bryant in a 35-33 comeback win Saturday. 
The Blue Devils (2-4, 1-1 Northeast Conference) overcame a 20-7 third quarter deficit. Devon Lofton's 4-yard run put the Blue Devils on top for good with 2:15 left. 
Bryant's Ricardo McCray ran for 174 yards on 19 carries and two touchdowns. His 45-yard score came with 4:47 left give his team a 33-29 lead. McCray had a 49-yard scoring dash minutes before that to give the Bulldogs a 26-21 lead. 
Between McCray's scoring runs, Tavion Pauldo completed an 84-yard scoring pass Nash to put the Blue Devils up 29-26. Pauldo was 15 for 21 for 245 yards, two touchdowns and an interception. 
Dalton Easton for Bryant (2-3, 0-1) completed 20 of 39 attempts with 228 yards passing, two touchdowns and an interception.
